name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Fall to pieces. Delete your thesis.
Break up the ships that chase golden fleeces.
Your pure imaginations
will fight angelic wars
as the talons of the sunset
touch the socially distanced stars."

From James Parker, the poet laureate of the pandemic: 
https://t.co/4zJb1VkzsB

text: RT @meghanor: I wrote for @atlantic about approaching the grim milestone of 100,000 deaths, and what it means for me and maybe all of us: https://t.co/8Gatg1pkNQ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @AdrienneLaF: "My father will ever after trace his resolve to become an undertaker to the first week of August in 1936. 

'Why?' we’d always ask... 'Why didn’t you decide to be a priest?'

'A priest?' he’d say, not one for metaphor or irony. 'The priest was dead.'" https://t.co/u8jhVNZpI4

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "It is graveyard upon graveyard upon graveyard. It is mass burials... bodies stacked in refrigerated trucks... Mostly, it is the shocking echo that follows the loss of even one person: zero, zero, zero, zero, zero. A lament: O, O, O, O, O." https://t.co/ATkix1QYTP

text: Gina McCarthy led Obama's EPA. Now she's fighting her old agency in the hopes of preserving the very policies she created, @mirandacgreen reports: https://t.co/gz2ifxEVLF

text: The ultimate legacy of the pandemic could be a broad erosion of trust in authorities, endangering public-health efforts into the future, @sarahzhang reports. https://t.co/phyYwydGYs
